verses.text: \sc Lord\sc*, how are they increased that trouble me! Many \add are\add* they that rise up against me.
Many \add there be\add* which say of my soul, \add There is\add* no help for him in God. Selah.
But thou, O \sc Lord\sc*, \add art\add* a shield for me; My glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
I cried unto the \sc Lord\sc* \add with\add* my voice, And he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the \sc Lord\sc* sustained me.
I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, That have set \add themselves\add* against me round about.
Arise, O \sc Lord\sc*; save me, O my God: For thou hast smitten all mine enemies \add upon\add* the cheek bone; Thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
Salvation \add belongeth\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc*: Thy blessing \add is\add* upon thy people. Selah.
